comment.body:
Using the docs specified here:
https://github.com/GoogleChrome/lighthouse/blob/main/docs/performance-budgets.md

This doesn't seem to want to dynamically check the pages under `/blog`? not sure what is going on.

issue.title: [chore] update github README with more details about the project
issue.body:
**What needs to be done**

The project's README should be updated with more information about the project itself. Right now its pretty bare.

- [ ] update the word "road-map" to just "roadmap". Add a description
- [ ] add a short description of the project, and where its available.
- [ ] move project readme to About page. Part of #194
- [ ] add badges, verify they work on the actual rendering of the page. Might have to update a custom parser to remove them?

issue.title: [Blog] Write about new project idea, for winter break

labels.name: blog
labels.description: An issue that represents a topic to write a blog post about

issue.body:
The new project is a VSCode extension to keep track of time within different files. The key difference is its focused on keeping track of this data locally. 

Will need to determine what's the best way to save data this way.

comment.body: closing due to possible removal of projects.

issue.title: [Feature] Add overview component
issue.body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**

this component should take the headers that appear on the blog posts content and appear on the left, along with the tags and other metrics.

On mobile these should appear at the top of the page above the main content.

commits.message: fix: minor alignment issue with homepage

issue.title: [Enhancement] Possibly remove the project concept entirely?
issue.body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**

Removing projects, and focusing more on external integrations and github itself might be a better use of resources and focus, rather than static-loading/management of separate assets for each project. 

For the most part, most projects have better information and documentation on their respective github repo's rather than the actual static project files included in this project. Plus, most of the static-project files specified are for projects done **years** ago, with only a few more recent ones.

issue.title: [feat] Add "tags" list on blog/projects that show similar ones
issue.body:

comment.body: Will be part of an overhaul of the blog page UI. Projects will stay the same for the time being.
